results.title: ‘Old’ Review: They Say Sun Can Age You, but This Is Ridiculous
results.abstract: A half-hour at the beach costs vacationers a year in this disquieting new horror puzzler, written and directed by M. Night Shyamalan.

results.title: ‘Space Jam,’ My Dad and Me
results.abstract: A writer adored the basketball-Looney Tunes mash-up as a boy. Watching the movie again after his father died, he felt the movie resonate in a surprisingly deeper way.

results.title: The Riddle of Riley Keough
results.abstract: The “Zola” actress has a knack for inhabiting working-class characters who feel real, even though her own family history is as outrageous as it gets.

multimedia.caption: Riley Keough on her career: “I don’t care if I fail. I have this attitude of, ‘Well, then I’ll just do better.’”

results.title: I’m Obsessed With ‘Old.’ The Twist: I Won’t See It.
results.abstract: M. Night Shyamalan’s new movie has a trailer that eerily resonates with our strange times; and that’s enough for me.

results.title: Vladimir Menshov, Surprise Russian Oscar Winner, Dies at 81
results.abstract: His “Moscow Does Not Believe in Tears” was named best foreign-language film in 1980, beating Truffaut and Kurosawa. U.S. critics demurred.
des_facet: Moscow Does Not Believe in Tears (Movie)

multimedia.caption: The Soviet filmmaker and actor Vladimir Menshov in an undated photo. His “Moscow Does Not Believe in Tears” won an Academy Award in 1980.

results.title: ‘Change is coming’ to streaming, says Jason Kilar, the WarnerMedia chief.
results.abstract: HBO and its streaming service, HBO Max, have attracted 67.5 million customers, and the company expects to reach 73 million by year end.

multimedia.caption: The release of made-for-the-big-screen spectacles like “Godzilla vs. Kong” on HBO Max helped to increase the service’s customer rolls.

results.title: In ‘Xiao Wu,’ a Wandering Pickpocket in the People’s China
results.abstract: Jia Zhangke’s debut feature, released in the United States in 1999 and newly restored, follows a nowhere man around his nowhere city in China.

results.title: Is Marvel’s ‘Loki’ a True Deviation? Or Just a Fun Experiment?
results.abstract: The latest Disney+ superhero show embraced chaos in its storytelling. Is Marvel willing to do the same within its ever expanding universe of films and TV shows?

results.title: Carol Easton, Biographer of Arts Figures, Dies at 87
results.abstract: Curious about creativity, she chronicled the lives of Agnes de Mille, Jacqueline du Pré, Samuel Goldwyn and Stan Kenton.

multimedia.caption: The author Carol Easton in an undated photo. She wrote well-received biographies of figures in the arts.

results.title: What to Watch: Animated Adventures
results.abstract: Animation can take you around the world — to Italy, Japan, France or a British chicken farm — or to worlds you haven’t imagined. Here are five transporting movies to stream.

results.title: ‘The New Bauhaus’ Review: Rethinking an Approach to Art
results.abstract: This documentary on the interdisciplinary artist Laszlo Moholy-Nagy makes the case that he should be a household name.
